website_summaries.verdict: Simple and stylish, the Canon PowerShot SD1200 IS is a fine back-pocket camera as long as your photo-quality expectations are reasonable.
cons: flat buttons can be difficult to press accurately

customer_reviews.title: Better than the newer ones
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these cameras for several years. Then it was water-damaged. Since it's a discontinued model, I bought an identical used camera from Amazon.com. These cameras are much better than any of the newer "equivalent" models. The current models brag nonsense such as, "Bigger LCD Screen!" Who cares? The new cameras don't have a viewfinder, which is essential if the sun is shining on the LCD screen. I find many products that are new aren't as good as what they've replaced. This is an example.
customer_reviews.author: Jadee

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a Canon PowerShot 1300 IS that stopped working after having had a heavy workload. I LOVED that camera. The camera still functions very well and easily fits into pants or jacket pockets. I could turn on my previous camera with one hand to take quick shots. This on/off button is smaller and harder to use and the USB connection has a flimsy plastic cover that looks like it may break off with repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: this camera works better. It takes great action shots of the kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera back in 2009. I now do photography as a hobby, and my husband has bought me a more expensive camera, this camera works better. It takes great action shots of the kids. It's perfect for sports events!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Bezak

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros 1. very light weight, small but easy to handle, menu easy to manage/navigate 2. improved quality pic taking. auto adjust to different environment/lighting, auto adjust to shaky hand. wide screen option is provided. 3. good looking design, multicolor, i got a green color cam to join Obama's "Green xyz" rah rah. 4. good pricing. $149. cheaper than my AS Powershot Cons 1. battery. need to walk around with a battery charger. inconvenient. nice if rechargeable from PC's USB port. 2. memory. camera comes without memory card, fortunately, i can swap the card from my other PowerShot cam. 3. cam pouch. nice if a small cloth pouch is provided. overall, great price for a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for above and below water operation
customer_reviews.text: I have selfie-video'd myself skiing, scuba diving, and roller blading... just get the underwater case for underwater. The flash actually works underwater on this setup, although the battery doesn't last a whole dive (40 pics) so bring two batteries. The zoom works well, controls aren't hard to learn (well, it's only my 5th Canon), and 10 Mpix is a good working resolution (not too big, not too fuzzy), and a great first camera too. Eats cheap SD memories. an 8GB will last you at least a year, unless you videotape a sports event. If you video, get a solid tripod.
customer_reviews.author: H. Schulze

customer_reviews.title: i recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom about 6 years ago and she still uses it all the time. She loves it. It's not fancy. It's just a simple point and shoot camera. If that's what you're looking for, i recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with optical viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera that has a viewfinder. Hard to find any decent camera with a optical viewfinder now and if you don't have one most cameras are almost useless in the bright sunlight. Great price too since this model is a few generations old.
customer_reviews.author: clreindeer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working To Early
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after a few years. Known problem that was not addressed when I contacted the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: bucks

customer_reviews.title: Our Canon camera purchased via Amazon
customer_reviews.text: As long-time Amazon customers,we are accustomed to receiving our orders quickly, but in this case,there was an unusually long delay, especially considering the fact that it was advertised as being "in stock". Also, we had expected to receive a memory card with it, however we evidently failed to follow Amazon's ordering procedure properly, so perhaps it was a case of not following the rules "fine-print? On the plus side, the camera is a remarkable product, and contrary to various negative customer reviews, ours functions perfectly, and we are pleased with it. Thank you, Bill and Joan Hannan
customer_reviews.author: J. Hannan

customer_reviews.title: Review of the Canon PowerShot SD 1200IS Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a digital camera for under $200 hundred dollars and came across the Canon Sd1200. After purchasing it at the price amazon was offering and using it I can say overall I am very satisfied with my choice. It produces really clear pictures, it's very easy to use, takes pictures fast, and it's size makes it easy to carry with you. Granted, I wasn't looking for a camera to turn out professional level shots, just casual ones, and it has met my expectations. Though I haven't had it for that long, so I can't attest to it's durability. Otherwise, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T.L. CenVal

customer_reviews.title: Looooove this camera! Canon is the best.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Canon camera!! I absolutely love everything about it. Great picture quality and construction/physique. GREAT macro shots and focusing. However when I let my sister hold onto it one night she spilled beer on it and killed it.. sad sad moment for me. I had to switch to a cheaper camera and its not the same at all. I miss this camera sooo much. Canon is hands down the best quality and best at making cameras! One day I hope to own another Canon and will treasure and guard it with my life!! I recommend this camera to anyone! Really fast and easy to use. You'll love it :-)
customer_reviews.author: L. Casey

customer_reviews.title: I wish I didn't loose it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in Jan of 2010 and I LOVE IT!! It is awesome! It does such a great job at stabilization that I can had it to my 4 yr old and let him take pictures and 4 out of 5 of them will turn out awesome even though he ran, jumped, and spun while shooting the pictures! I could also take pictures out the window in my car while driving 80mph and have very little blur from the trees going by!! I'm so sad I misplaced this camera! I want it back because no other camera I have owned compares to this camera!! I hope I find it soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Looking for the Perfect Item

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this to supplement my Canon S2 IS, for times when I don't want to lug a bulky camera around. This camera put the fun back in picture taking! I think the image stabilization is much better than in my other Canon and the colors seem more vivid. The only time the larger camera is definitely better is the 12X optical zoom vs this little guy's 3X zoom. I like this camera so well I am buying one for my son whose camera recently died. The only annoying issue is that I paid $169 at Amazon 2 weeks ago and now it is $179. That doesn't seem fair.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great camera if you want good shots with little thought!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a trip to England. I took about 270 shots and can think of only two that came out poorly that I could blame on the camera itself. I was going to read the manual on the plane but that never happened, so I was taking shots based on figuring out the camera as I went, and it was really quite simple to operate. It took excellent shots indoors and outdoors in all kinds of conditions. If you are interested in a camera that takes great shots without a lot of thought from you for vacations, family events, etc., this is a solid choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Third Elph
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canon Elph. I bought the first one over 15 years ago when they still took Advantage film. Number 2 was my first digital camera and it is still working great although it is 8 years old. I bought number 3 to replace number 2 when, if ever it goes out. Also I noticed the newest Elphs do not have a peep hole on the camera and I still need to use one in the strong sunlight when you can't see the screen. Yes, I would recommend this camera although I haven't had it but a couple of months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Camera For Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! Fits in my pocket and can take it anywhere (except near water). Takes nice sharp photos. Great indoor and nighttime pics with flash. All the bells and whistles the average person would need. I like that you have a choice of viewfinder or screen. Got it on sale and it's a great value. No other camera in this price range compares. I get lots of compliments on the quality of my photos. Have been using for the past year or so and couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: sprucehen

customer_reviews.title: same ol' point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Nothing too special... If I go to extreme cold or heat or anywhere with dust/dirt (e.g. Coachella, Burning Man) then the lens would have retracting issues, but if I just pushed it shut it would work itself out after a few weeks post-trip. It takes pictures horribly blurry without the flash, but that's most cameras anyway. Same as all of my previous Canons, if you turn off the eye lamp then it will take the picture quicker.
customer_reviews.author: FRUHD

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera after our daughter played with our other Canon Elph at the beach and got sand stuck in the lens extender. We loved our other camera and really wanted to stay within the Canon family with our new one. Picture quality is excellent and the video feature saved us from buying a separate video camera. I especially love the zoom feature with videos (wasn't available on our old camera). All in all, it's a great price for a great camera. Perfect for taking shots of my on-the-go toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Ali_Lei

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my niece. I know the camera is solid for taking pics us non professionals shoot! Selected the orange camera and hoped she liked it. Turns out the color is very attractive and she loves it. Also easy to find her camera at a party. If you are looking for a good camera in a distinctive color I recommend this one. I did not give four stars only because I have not taken any pics with it myself so cannot talk to quality. I do have an earlier non color version which takes excellent pics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my little green camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Canon camera I've owned. I just gave my Canon SD750 to my son so he can take pictures of his carpentry work. I needed a camera with more MPG's to photograph my Jewelry for my new website. I just love the ease of getting good quality pictures that show the beauty of the Swarovski crystals I make my jewelry with. Great sparkle quality!!!!! My camera is always close at hand, you never know when something beautiful will catch your eye, out comes my Canon. Point and voila!! a great picture.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Danker

customer_reviews.title: Canon Does it Again
customer_reviews.text: We have a Canon 710, bought last year, but it rarely comes out of its case since we recently got the SD1200. It's small, sleek, has a bright and sharp screen image, easily slips into a purse or a jacket pocket, takes very clear and sharp closeups, and has an optical viewfinder which is very useful when taking action shots. A couple of things I don't like are the very small control buttons and ring. It would also be nice to have a more powerful zoom lens. I bought this camera for my special lady, but I've been using it more than she has.
customer_reviews.author: Noble Metal

customer_reviews.title: The photos aren't that great but not bad
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed since I had higher expectations from this camera. It's ok and does the job but the photo quality is not that great. The flash is certainly too powerful and makes photos taken with flash way too bright. Sometimes the auto doesn't focus correctly and I have to turn it off and on again for it to work and by then the photo opportunity goes away! Right now, my iPhone photos are better.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in December 2009. Since then I have taken well over 20,000 pictures and several hours of video. The PowerShot can take a beating and keep running smoothly. It's small enough that it won't burden you on long trips and the battery packs charge up quickly. The optical to digital zoom allows for fantastic quality pictures. Never once did I have any major problems with this camera. I gladly recommend it to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was a simple, easy to use camera that had a view finder like a old "film" type. I am farsighted and the viewfinders that are screens are impossible for me to use without my reading glasses - and with reading glasses, I can't see far! I also had no use for a lot of features. All I wanted was a camera that took high quality pictures and was not so small that I might mistake it for a credit card! My son did some research and came up with this camera. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyBeagle

customer_reviews.title: My sister loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister's birthday. She LOVES it. I like the price and bought it solely on reviews. She loves orange so that worked out well too. She said it takes great pictures and she loves all of the features that are on it. The picture quality was much better than her kodak that broke after a year of owning it. I do wish that amazon would offer signature conformation for all higher end items. This package ended up missing for a few days but said was delivered. I was very upset that they didn't required a signature on a digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: HFEW13

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera but the Battery module could have been better
customer_reviews.text: This Camera is great...its small and powerful...I never took such good pictures at night. The flash is very powerful which sometimes makes ur face look ultra bright but I guess thats ok... The picture quality during the day is good too and so are the number of features available. The only thing I don't like is how I have to take the battery out of the Camera every time I wanna charge it. I wish they would do something about it in the next versions.
customer_reviews.author: Mayur Jain

customer_reviews.title: Canon  Powershot SD1200IS camera review
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived promptly, however; upon using it I found that it had an annoying issue. When turned on in the "auto" program, the lens constantly made noise and the lens would try and focus repeatedly until the shutter button was held down and ultimately take the photo. This did not occur in any other mode. I returned the camera as I was unsure if it was defective or my dissatisfaction. Additionally, as other reviewers noted the viewfinder is too small and useless.
customer_reviews.author: P. E. Malon

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade my old Canon Elph from the SD1000 and saw this one. I am very happy with it, I am also very happy with the seller. I ordered this not thinking that my birthday was coming up, but ended up getting it on my birthday, and gift wrapped as well!! Anyway, this camera is a joy, small and light - it takes great photos in almost any condition. The videos as well are wonderful - great color and sound quality. Wonderful camera for most anyone.
customer_reviews.author: G. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact camera WITH VIEWFINDER!
customer_reviews.text: My wife really wanted a shirt pocket sized camera as a backup to her Nikon, but she wanted a viewfinder. It's becoming harder and harder to find viewfinders on anything less than the DSLR's, but this Canon had one. It's not perfect, but for those times when it is really bright out, or you are having problems holding the camera steady, the viewfinder is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: akh

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the wife
customer_reviews.text: My wife was wanting a nice small camera that she could keep in her purse. We have a Nikon D60 that we both love and takes wonderful pictures, but you cant really drag that around everywhere. Its the type of camera you take with you when you know you want to take pictures. This Cannon PowerShot takes as good or better pictures then the D60 and she can take it everywhere. It is the perfect camera to buy if you want a high quality camera with you at all times, for those "random" moments that you want to remember.....or for those not-so-random moments that you want to remember but your friends would pay money for you to forget!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Mandeville

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon, they cannot disappoint my family and I. I bought this for my girlfriend and she used to have this Olympus one but I got her into the Canon line of cameras and she noticed the picture quality. Worth the buy, and honestly it has good picture quality. You get what you pay for, and with this you will get what you want....Trust me I was playing with that thing the first second I saw it and took a ton of pictures everywhere we went. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Steps forward and back
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Canon PowerShot I bought. This model has some improvements over the previous model when it comes to shooting night time shots and lights. However, I found after a week that a lot of my shots are blurry. It might have to do with the stability setting. The older model didn't have that. The previous powershot was also heavier, metal, and made in Japan. This model is lighter, plastic, and made in China. While I like the lighter feel to it, I hope it holds up over time. If not, it might be my last PowerShot. If it holds up and I figure out the blur problem, I will definitely continue to buy PowerShots.
customer_reviews.author: A. Simoncelli

customer_reviews.title: Good product,  not Great
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera very much. It's easy to use, which is good for the novice, and has some advanced features. The size is great, and battery life is good. I remain disappointed in low natural light pictures. This camera does appear to be a nice upgrade in photo quality from the TX-1 it is replacing, although I already miss the flip screen viewer. For the money, it's hard to complain. No problems with ordering or delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Gillie

customer_reviews.title: It finally joined the defective pile...
customer_reviews.text: It worked OK for two years, that's the reason for the two stars... but it's DEAD now. They should put "DISPOSABLE" in the box, so it wouldn't hit you that hard when it stops working with no reason. I can't believe Canon is still getting away with this, shows you the power of corporate impunity, not just by putting a defective product on the shelf but not doing anything about it. Shameful...
customer_reviews.author: Left behind in TN

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a new camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera two years ago. Originally, I was pleased. However, I have to agree with many of the other reviewers. I am getting so many blurry photos, it's not worth keeping anymore. I have tried all the suggestions mentioned with no luck. Not sure what the problem is. Tonight was the final straw. I was at a school musical, took about 10 pictures, 8 were blurry. Took two shots with my video camera which was at a much lower resolution, and the pics were awesome!! I tried, I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: Pippi

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a photographer but I read the reviews and decided to purchase this camera. My last camera was a vivitar which did not last very long. I received my camera recently and I simply love it. I've not gotten a chance to check out all the features but for someone like me who knows little about photography this camera is easy to use, small and handy and I love the great green colour. I would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It had other photos on it so i had to delete them, but other than that it was great. but it didnt have battery when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: Canon powershot sd1200
customer_reviews.text: One of the very best features of this Canon is the viewfinder. Picture quality is outstanding. I've taken pictures outdoors, the pictures have been clear and crisp. I have taken quite a few pictures indoors with equally impressive results. I would highly recommend the Canon PowerShot SD 1200 IS to anyone looking for a reasonably priced digital camera that is extremely simple to use and yet loaded with great features.
customer_reviews.author: Daydreamer

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Canon SD600 and decided to finally update. Ordered this because of my good experience with Canon and it did not disappoint. Pictures are clear and in focus. I was skeptical about the face recognition feature, but it's a real help. The camera is amazingly small and the rounded corners give it a nice feel. It fits into even the tiniest camera cases. Looking forward to taking it on vacation this year.
customer_reviews.author: Art Chik

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after a lot of research, and I am so glad that I did! I bought it almost five years ago, and it is still going strong! I actually bought a bigger camera (different brand) just last year (Black Friday impulse buy), and I must say that my Canon PowerShot still takes better pictures. It is small, fits in my pocket easily, and takes very crisp, colorful photos. I also appreciate the rechargeable battery as well.
customer_reviews.author: MichMama

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for several years now and I have no idea why I've never rated it. I absolutely love it and it hasn't failed on me yet. The batter lasts for a very long time. It is easy to use for those of us who suck at technology related items and the quality of the photos are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD1200 Review
customer_reviews.text: Not long after I bought this camera I traveled to Southern California and ended up taking over 800 pictures! They all turned out great!! Just make sure you get a high speed SD card so the time it takes to save each picture after you take it can be reduced. I love how small it is! I was able to ride a bunch of rides at Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland and didn't have to worry about the camera at all!
customer_reviews.author: Wendalstat

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT camera!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Powershot takes pictures superfast and ultra-clear. It even takes photos with a subtle depth of field, in other words you can focus on something in the foreground and the background will be slightly blurred. Its a lot like using a 35mm, or the Digital Rebel. The photos are amazing! I used to have a Sony and everything looked so flat. You can get some real artistic shots with this little beauty....and the best part is that its shocking hot pink and I got mine for under $200!!! I love it:)
customer_reviews.author: Jen H

customer_reviews.title: canon sd1200is
customer_reviews.text: I like canon digital cameras. I owned 3 or 4 before that one. I thought this one will be better then prevous models, but nothing much has been improved. Most of the time picture would come clear, but sometimes blurry, even all the settings are set up, the focusing not all the time does a good job when you need to take a quick picture and especially while moving. I still like canon but next time will try to buy other model.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very good in low light, Handy, Versatility, Great Resolution, Large Clear LCD, Nice Features and Settings, Can zoom optically when recording video, Good Battery Life, Dynamic Range, Optical View Finder, Tops on Consumer Reports subcompact camera ratings Cons: Complicated Controls, First shot delay, Some image noise, No Panoramic mode Best Uses: Everyday Photos, Home, Travel
customer_reviews.author: gabazero

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - but
customer_reviews.text: So far the camera delivers good photo quality as expected, HOWEVER it makes a crunching / grinding noise when it focuses. Now, i did the research and found out that this is "normal" for this camera and not an issue with the camera itself. If this noise will bother you (and i have to admit, when i hear it i wonder - WTF - until i tell myself..."its ok, its NORMAL try to ignore it") then get a different camera.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: PowerShot 1200IS Review
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely superb picture quality! This is a great camera, in all regards, except for the following "chinks in the armor:" - Repeat shots are "okay," but I'd prefer to have them quicker - Image downloads require yet another application ... not hard to do, but it could be easier. Overall ... this is a great camera, worth every penny ... and more! Tony B
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of shopping around before buying this. I looked at Canon, Nikon, and many other popular brands. After deciding on this model, I couldn't wait for it to arrive. I have been SO happy with it. My husband is a photographer and uses a large, fancy camera, and even he is impressed with the picture quality on such a small camera. My daughter and I share this camera and we both give it an A+!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good zoom and great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Still use this instead of the phone because of the versatility. Also, one of the few small cameras with a viewfinder. Good zoom and great pictures. Get a backup battery, however, if you're travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Phyljaf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel camera
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this little camera for a trip to London this Christmas season. Lots of museums, night time activities, dimly lit pubs. Of course we brought the battery charger, but forgot our adapter....so we crossed our fingers that the battery would hold for a week. No problem! It slides easily in and out of a pocket, took great photos in the daylight and night. Even night shots without flash came out beautifully. Our other camera is a canon also, so the controls were easy to learn. The leather case barely increased the size overall and gave good protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jean L. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Bought this ages ago- but still love it. I have a DSLR and film cameras ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ages ago- but still love it. I have a DSLR and film cameras by this is my "fun" camera. The batter lasts me forever. Took it in my trip to Costa Rica and people thought my pictures were taken with my DSLR. It's a great find!
customer_reviews.author: Carly A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Canon is always great, very easy to use. You can get nice results with it. and the color is just amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Seaeagle

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect and produced great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my film business I had a few years ago. Worked perfect and produced great pics
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to details on description
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize when I purchased this particular camera that it was second hand and missing a lot of things or I would never have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a gret little camera. It is fairly easy to understand (I wouldn't give to my grandmother, but my mother can use it), and works smoothly. I carried it around Italy in the front pocket of my jeans and barely noticed it. It works well in low light when you cannot use a flash... and lets you know when you are shaking it to much to get a clean shot. Very good camera and the color can't be beat. I bought it for my wife, who decided it was much funnier if I carried it for her.
customer_reviews.author: Polar Bear

customer_reviews.title: PIcture this
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price on a product that looks new and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Great little Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a smaller camera to take with us on vacation. We purchased this camera and couldn't be happier. It is small emough to fit into a pocket so carrying it around was never a burden. The point and shoot capabilities are really great. We were in Cabo and this camera took great pictures no matter what the lighting was. The video record feature is excellent and we got some great footage of the waves crashing in. I had previously never had a camera with face detection and have found this feature invaluable. Still playing around with everything this camera has to offer. Stick with Cannon they make a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Knochenmus

customer_reviews.title: This was a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little camera. Good quality photos. Easy to use. Bought an elph 135 when this camera went away to college. The 135 is terrible. Don't know what happened to Canon Quality but if you can get this version of PowerShot - GET IT. No problems ever for all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Sonne M. Devries

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera. Cute, too!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is adorable, very compact, and takes great pictures. I bought it to replace an older one I'd had for several years. This one is more megapixels and the photos it takes are really good. I love how compact and light it is -- easy to slip in my purse or a jacket pocket.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a couple of years and really like it. The screen is still in great condition and hasn't scratched like an older camera I have. The photos always turn out great as there is an auto on the camera but also manual controls that allow you to change the settings if you are indoors (like at a concert).
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: a so-so camera
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this camera, so I had high hopes for it. Unfortunately, I've been a bit disappointed, because: 1) you have to go through software to transfer pictures to the computer; the camera doesn't mount as a drive when connected to the computer (as every other digital camera I've had has done). 2) in order to turn off the flash, you have to switch modes on the camera. 3) the flash is too bright. I wish it were either less bright or adjustable. It works -- I can take pictures with it -- but I don't like it as much as the 5-year-old camera it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: too_old_to_be_so_indie

customer_reviews.title: Great little pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera to replace an older Canon digital camera. This one has rechargable batteries, which our old one didn't have. I like still having a small viewfinder in addition to the larger window. The picture quality is quite good and it has a really nice face-finding focus that even has multiple face finders if you are taking a picture of a group.
customer_reviews.author: MaDrap

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I do love this camera, however I'm not a huge fan of the cropping option since I can't find one. My other small complaint is the video, you can't hear any sound when you replay a video from the camera. Slightly inconvienent however it sounds great once you transfer the video onto your computer. I do love the size of the camera and most pictures turn out great! The camera is also very easy to use and most settings are easy to change/figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Wnek

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Function, Everytime
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best purchases I've made on Amazon. The camera is simple, easy to use, just like all Cannons. There is enough available timing/lighting modifications to make it fun if you're into that kind of thing, but if you're just pointing and clicking, this camera works incredibly fast. No triple bright refocus settings, no blinding flashes. It just takes pictures accurately and clearly the first time with minimal focus delay. I've also beat the hell out of it, and it still works. Always a good thing to report. Been to Europe twice and Mexico once.... still ticking. Even survived my 5 year old nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Beejman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camrea
customer_reviews.text: I got Camera for my brother as a gift. He was looking for a cheap portable camera, because he likes to travel a lot, spends a lot of time camping etc. This camera is so small its amazing! and the quality of the pictures are great. I was very impressed with the quality of the video, I really didn't expect so much from such a small camera. A great buy in a great price.
customer_reviews.author: I. Avneri

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera almost a year ago and nothing has mal-functioned (yet). Great quality, great pictures, great close ups (I'll try and attach a few photos, but I haven't seen that option yet). Camera is light and I can take it anywhere. The different functions are great, Macro for extreme close-ups and Infinity for distance. The only down side is that it doesn't have color options like other cameras I've used and it takes poor night shots. Get one...you thank me later. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Female

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but WHY is the charger gray?
customer_reviews.text: This camera is really cool, takes great pictures, but mine came with a gray-colored battery and a gray-colored charger. Previously I had ordered the same one, and the charger was white, and the battery was white. White looks SO much sharper than gray. That's my only complaint! Other than the cheap-looking battery charger, this camera is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chispi

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Digi Cam
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality and the video mode picture is fantastic! BUT, I purchased this one to replace my other. The lens went out on my other one and everything looked blurry. I had that one for about a year. My one prior to that had the same problems...I used my camera daily for work purposes, but I really got my moneys worth out of it! I recommend it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jersey

customer_reviews.title: State of the Art
customer_reviews.text: This is a top of the line camera. The only thing wrong with it is me. I'm not a very good photographer, but this camera makes me look a lot better than I am. The controls are pretty intuitive; my only complaint is you have to get used to the arrow keys being labeled as something else. I can't vote on the battery life because I haven't had to charge it yet (except for the first time. The detail in the photos is exquisite.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Sweig

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of all the functions and specially for the size of it. Slim and compact, you can take it everywhere. The battery lasts very long, even when you are taking video. I recommend to use a 4GB SD card or greater. SanDisk is always the best choice for SD cards. Also, the Canon Leather Compact Case PSC-55, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Canon 620 which has been a marvelous camera but I wanted something smaller and lighter. The 1200 is a wonderful little camera one third the weight of the 620 and takes equally good, sharp photos if not better. I bought a small case to wear on my belt and take the 1200 along wherever I go. Even the videos are sharp and the sound quite real.
customer_reviews.author: hobby fan

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. Got it for an excellent price when Cannon was introducing there next new line of cameras. Bought it to replace a cannon SD 770IS that was stolen & I liked it. This model is just as good but I don't see any major improvements. I'm not big camera person so this model does fine & should be fine for the average user.
customer_reviews.author: Drew K.

customer_reviews.title: LoveIt!
customer_reviews.text: I received my first Canon PowerShot Elph from my brother over 4 years ago. So this was an upgrade for me. I loved my first one and I love this one.My mother has one, too, and she is very pleased with hers as well. I am still getting a feel for my new one, but I am very happy with it! The orange color is awesome! And the fact that you can recharge the battery appeals to my "green" side!
customer_reviews.author: A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice pocket camera which has worked well for us as ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice pocket camera which has worked well for us as a second camera for trips. It lacks a good stabilizer and has minimal zoom but otherwise, serves well.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: We have had this camera for a long time now and it is so easy to use. Takes great pictures and the zoom function is great for a small camera. We download our pics on our computer with ease as well using the associated plug and software that came with it. I would buy this camera again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Power shot 1200
customer_reviews.text: We previously had a Cannon G3 and loved the quality of pics and the color rendition, but it is a larger camera and cant put it in shirt pocket and heavy for purse. This one is a lot smaller, quality pics, larger lcd, easy to use, and has image stabilization. So far, we love it. Does not come with memory card so get one and an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hambright

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting a little more...but good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It says that it automatically detects movement, but I have taken pictures that it has not automatically corrected the movement. I like it overall, but a little disappointed in that the picture taking quality is not what I expected it to be. The size is perfect, it fits in your pocket and is really light. It is easy to use, point and shoot, but it is best to pre-focus to get it to shoot quicker.
customer_reviews.author: A. Beckendorf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an excellent choice for a digital camera. We wanted something smaller and lighter to replace our older Canon digital. Features are great, and picture quality thus far seems excellent. A nice feature is the pre-programed settings for various situations (e.g. beach, kids with all their motion, night scenes, etc.). Our only complaint is that the rechargable battery life is not a good as our old Canon which took either rechargable or regular AA's. The solution is probably to get another battery, so we've always got a fully charged one on hand. Other than this one issue, I'd recommend this model highly.
customer_reviews.author: James Carson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for someone who takes pictures for concerts, beach, out with friends or any other random things. I am young and dont need a camera for much but special occasions and this camera has not disappointed. I have used it at several concerts and it was perfect. The zoom could be a little better but I cant complain. Also I am very happy with the video. Plenty of space to record numerous things or a 14 minute song at a Clapton concert.
customer_reviews.author: W. Peay

customer_reviews.title: Compared to A570IS, terrible
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and love the battery life. Images suck. I couldn't figure out what was wrong, but after using this form months, I realized, it simply was not nearly as good as my A570. White balance always off, image clarity/sharpness, etc. I'm not using it anymore and feel ripped off. It's a good camera, but just not an improvement at all beyond the A-series.
customer_reviews.author: Dave_3590

customer_reviews.title: ... had this camera almost 10 years and it takes EXCELLENT pictures and is very user
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera almost 10 years and it takes EXCELLENT pictures and is very user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Georgia O'Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a nikon s220 coolpix that I used for 8 months until I broke the LCD screen and I was always a little disappointed with the pictures it took. I replaced it with the canon powershot sd1200is and have been very happy with my choice. The pictures are sharp with colors and exposure that look great even when I take shots without the flash. If you're looking for a simple point and shoot camera that you can carry with you everywhere I can definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bluegrass

customer_reviews.title: Canon
customer_reviews.text: love my digital camera! it was a great deal! i've had it since '09 and still in good condition considering how much it was used before i got my iphone. i still like to use my digital tho. much easier for me to get the pictures printed and put all of them on my computer
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnne Pusateri

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: New shape looks good, has a little heft suggesting a lot is to be expected from it's small size. This purchase is the second of two SD1200s bought as family gifts. Easy to use and was no challenge for my wife in the upgrade from her old SD1000. A little disappointed that her spare batteries did not fit the redesigned camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Sister
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister to use. Coupled the gift with a 16gb SDHC card from Patriot. Purchased in March of 2010. Have used the camera a few times, when my sister comes over with her son and I'll take photos of the two of them. Amazon always comes in as the better deal than what I can get locally.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ruvio

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS
customer_reviews.text: For my level this camera is great. I've had a canon SureShot 35mm for decades and it still takes great pics so I stuck with that brand to go digital. I wanted the traditional view finder on any digital I would get and that's the case with the Canons. I also consider reports from "Consumer Reports" magazine. So I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AbbysK

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This Canon PowerShot SD1200IS, 10 MP is the best little camera I've owned. Easy set up and intructions. I had a Sony to learn on, but love this little camera - it takes great pictures..Love the Auto setting. The best thing for me, the camera comes with a long life battery and charger, no more Double A batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice camera. We are still testing it and so far, it has presented very good quality. It's a bit heavy for a small camera, but I guess that means that it is built well. The screen is pretty fast when turned on/off. The devices are very easy to understand, however,it is always important to read the manual to better use the camera's settings. A lot of times the reason why we don't get the results we expect is because we don't know how to use the camera properly.
customer_reviews.author: Be Inquisitive

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is our fourth Canon purchase. Like the rest, we have become very pleased with the product. There is some tendency to cheapen the housing etc from one to the next. I think the USB access cover is going to break any day now. Quality is good. I really do not need the increased megapixels but this is the trend for the industry. The screen size is great. I like the new button to move from picture to picture. I am happy with the purchase. Wish they had not changed battery size as we lose the flexibity to share batteries and chargers.
customer_reviews.author: D. G

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I chose the SD 1200 based on a recommendation by a consumer review organization, and based on reviews by people who bought the camera. It's small and powerful. Although the SD 1200 has been replaced by the SD 1300, the 1200 seems to have all (or almost all) of the features of the 1300, and it has a viewfinder. It's also substantially cheaper than the 1300. It works great, looks great, and has many features that I'm sure I'll never actually use.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!! BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon Elph cameras. They take amazing pictures, are easy to use and are the perfect size to take anywhere. I bought this one after my Canon Elph 700 model fell into the water at Busch Gardens. I am so happy with it. They finally improved the first shot delay. With an 18 month old, the delay on my old camera was killing me and I was missing some good moments due to the delay. I am sure that there are better cameras out there but for the price this one is a great choice. Check Consumer Reports, this one is rated as the #1 best buy for compact digital cameras.
customer_reviews.author: K. Holland

customer_reviews.title: A smaller replacement with bigger results
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this camera to replace a larger Fuji. I wanted more portability, but worried that I would miss the more powerful zoom of my older camera (6 yrs old). We took this on a trip to the zoo and could not be happier. It will definately satisfy those who are back in the market for a good, easy to use camera. I'm a point-and-shoot, "leave it on automatic" sort of girl. I left a photo that we took with this camera in the customer images section (it's a bird being fed birdseed in the zoo)...check it out, this camera is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Elyssa Grace

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD1200IS
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this camera and am delighted. I haven't found one flaw yet and doubt that I ever will. The features are awsome, the picture quality superb and ease of use was just what I was looking for. I highly recommend this camera or any other camera that bears the name Canon PowerShot.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes amazing pictures. The photos are clear and crisp and the color is absolutely vivid. I purchased this particular camera because it was given a great review by Consumer Reports, and they were right! I am extremely pleased with my new Canon Poweshot SD 1200. It's everything you need in a digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but not durable
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice camera, but it only lasted about a year before it broke. Not at all durable. If you have kids, get something else. Otherwise this was pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: John Biddison

customer_reviews.title: great little camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace my old Canon digital elph SD510. I am really pleased with this camera. The recycle time is the biggest improvement as well as the image quality and great image stability. The facial recognition is excellent and quick. I even found that it will recognize a face on a TV screen. The battery life is also greatly improved and extra batteries are easy to find online. With a 4 GB chip you can take 700 pictures or so, plenty for most of us. Overall great little camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner Camera, light on quality construction.
customer_reviews.text: Good startup camera for point and shoot. There is a real difference in the quality of the construction between this and other Canon products I've owned. Slow focus. Good picture quality. Features are very helpful giving options to "auto mode" I think I would go up a model or two next time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third and last Canon, and I must say that as good as it is, it feels flimsier than the prior two. The photos are great, which is really what counts. There's no instruction booklet with it which another negative. It just infuriates me the way companies make us work for every bit of information we need on these products anymore. Is it really that hard to include the instructions? Also, I ordered a 4GB San Disk, so Amazon (I guess) took out the original San Disk, replaced with this 4GB one, but I didn't get the original. What's that all about?
customer_reviews.author: Cookster

customer_reviews.title: I hate this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this camera. I'm very surprised that I liked my similar Kodak model I previously owned (M1033) a lot better. So many auto focus photos turn out blurry and by the time the camera takes the picture the moment is gone. Also, it doesn't have nearly as many preset settings to choose from as the Kodak model, and the menu from which you choose them from is confusing. I've been very displeased with Kodak's customer service and so I thought I'd try Canon, since it has a good reputation, but I was nothing but frustrated and unhappy with this Canon digital camera, will be returning it, and repurchasing the Kodak model.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Small Point & Shoot Camera with a Viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: This small Point-and-Shoot digital camera was purchased because it also has a viewfinder. I have found that it is extremely difficult to compose a picture in bright sunlight using an LCD screen as in most Point-and Shoot cameras. And I was familiar with the excellent quality of the pictures from this model because my daughter has the same camera. The two newer powershot models (1300 & 1400) do not have viewfinders which I consider is a big mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Norman K. Bohrer

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray)
product_meta.description:
Color:Dark GrayFeatures 10.0-megapixel CCD For capturing high-resolution images up to 3648 x 2736. 3x optical zoom Gets you close to your subject for detail-rich images. 2.5" LCD display With 115,000 pixels to help you find the perfect shot then get a close-up view of the image. DIGIC IIII image processing Provides enhanced clarity and detail for your photos. Special scene modes Include foliage, snow, beach, sunset, fireworks, aquarium, kids and pets, indoor and more so you can choose the optimum setting for your shot. Face detection technology Isolates subjects in-frame and optimizes conditions for the best pictures of friends and family.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


When a camera puts a smile on your face the moment you hold it, imagine how great you’ll feel when you see your first pictures! The PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH has everything going for it--exuberant color, the sculptured style of Canon’s famed ELPH series--and the innovative know-how that takes you to a whole new level of picture-taking accomplishment. Fun, smart and a style that follows you everywhere. 

PowerShot SD1200 IS Highlights 

10.0-megapixel resolution makes it a breeze to print large size images


With the PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH, dramatic, personal pictures have never been easier to shoot and share. This 10.0-megapixel camera lets you create impressive, large photos of family and friends you’ll be proud display. The high-resolution images taken by the SD1200 IS Digital ELPH can be enlarged up to 13 x 19 inches. 

The PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

Large, crisp 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II and wide viewing angle
The PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH gives you a large 2.5-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. Canon’s PureColor LCD II offers spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle. The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light--a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH to Smart AUTO and you’re ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It’s a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you’re photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you’re getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 17 Shooting Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

A World of Advantages with Canon’s Technology 

The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has evolved Face Detection Technology that tracks the faces of moving subjects and lets the shooter enter the frame seamlessly with the Face Detection Self-Timer. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor 
Canon’s most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you’re ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A Face Detection Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures. 1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken. 2) The PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback. 3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode. 

What's in the Box

 * PowerShot SD1200 IS Digital ELPH body 
 * Lithium-ion battery pack (NB-6L) 
 * Battery charger (CB-2LY) 
 * Wrist strap (WS-DC7) 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB interface cable (IFC-400PCU) 
 * AV cable (AVC-DC400)

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
3x optical zoom; 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II screen
10.0-megapixel resolution captures enough detail for prints up to 13 x 19 inches
DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology , Face Detection Self-timer
10.0-megapixel resolution captures enough detail for prints up to 13 x 19 inches
3x optical zoom; 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II screen
DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology; Face Detection Self-timer
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)
